title: How a Missing Nutrient Can Hurt Young Brains
summary: Scientists found that when young people have obesity, it can harm their brains early on. They discovered that low levels of choline, a nutrient found in foods like eggs and broccoli, are linked to brain cell damage and inflammation. Choline helps keep our brains and livers healthy. The study shows that not getting enough choline might make it easier for obesity to cause problems. Researchers say eating more choline-rich foods can protect the brain as we grow older. This is important because many young people don't get enough choline in their diets.

background_read: Choline is a nutrient that our bodies need from food to stay healthy. It helps build brain cells and control inflammation. Obesity means having too much body fat, which can cause problems like heart disease. Scientists study how these things affect young people's brains to help prevent issues later in life.
